programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Greg Davies sets Alice Levine, Asim Chaudhry, Liza Tarbuck, Russell Howard and Tim Vine brilliantly bewildering tasks, including wheelbarrow stunts and lemon towers.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.sub-title: Would I Lie to You? At Christmas
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts a festive edition of the comedy panel show, in which team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by Richard Osman, Tom Courtenay, Sara Pascoe and Chris Kamara. As usual, all participants will be hoping to deceive one another with plausible lies, such as Richard stating he has never seen Breaking Bad because of his Homes Under the Hammer addiction, Sir Tom claiming he enjoys whiskey on his Christmas morning cornflakes, and Chris explaining that his full name is actually Christmas Kamara. The team also presents a somewhat unusual take on the Nativity.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Gary Lineker hosts an extended edition of the satirical quiz as guests including comedian Jon Richardson join team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's news stories.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.sub-title: Would I Lie to You? The Unseen Bits
programme.desc: Rob Brydon, Lee Mack and David Mitchell feature in a special episode of out-takes, looking back over some of the best moments. Among the celebrity guests are Kevin Bishop, Warwick Davis, Romesh Ranganathan, Hugh Dennis, Sara Cox and Brian Blessed.

programme.title: Hypothetical
programme.desc: Roisin Conaty, Victoria Coren-Mitchell, Darren Harriott and Phil Wang are posed increasingly absurd hypothetical situations. Hosted by Josh Widdicombe and James Acaster.

programme.title: Zapped
programme.desc: The Super Solstice represents Brian's last chance to get home, but to do so he needs to keep Howell alive and sober enough to cast a spell.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville decides a fashion makeover is needed to impress Stephanie from the local boutique, but Arkwright's meddling soon puts paid to any romantic dalliance. Roy Clarke's classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Nurse Gladys decides Arkwright needs a lesson in politeness, and convinces him a writer for the Good Shop Guide is doing the rounds. She then poses as the critic to see for herself the unusual sight of the miserly shopkeeper being nice to his customers. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Lynda Baron.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The untold secret story of war production that shaped the Second World War, beginning with how the German aviation industry came to dominate the skies of Europe.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson travels along the north Norfolk coast through one of the least developed spots in Britain, finding out how the area maintained its rural, remote identity despite the dynamic industrial changes of the Victorian age. From the arrival of Bertie, Prince of Wales at Sandringham House to the opening of Cromer Pier, Tony's four-day walk sees him learn about key periods in the county's history. He explores prime shooting estates, purpose-built seaside resorts, salt marshes and disused railway lines as he discovers how powerful landowners were able to control development and even shape the railways to suit their needs.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson embarks on another expedition through some of Britain's most historic landscapes. The moors and valleys of West Yorkshire were the home of, and inspiration for, the Brontes, the literary family who produced such classics as Wuthering Heights and Jane Eyre. Over four days, Tony heads out from the Victorian wool capital of Bradford and treks in a giant loop around what is now known as Bronte Country. From the birth of Charlotte, Emily, Anne and their brother Branwell in the suburb of Thornton, he traces their childhoods to the much-romanticised Bronte hub of Haworth, finding that the harsh reality of life in the 1820s was far removed from the fantasy world dreamed up by the children at their father's parsonage home.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.sub-title: Walking Through History: Victoria and Albert's Highland Fling
programme.desc: Tony Robinson visits the Cairngorms National Park to discover how Queen Victoria and Prince Albert helped shape Scottish traditions and imagery, such as tartan, bagpipes and caber-tossing. Starting in Pitlochry, he traverses the Killiecrankie Pass, where the Jacobites won the Battle of Killiecrankie, and ends his trek at Balmoral and the fantasy castle Albert built as his and Victoria's Highland escape.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: The Secrets of the Vatican Archives
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston visits Rome to speak to Church officials, expert archivists, scholars and authors about some of the historical treasures stored in the Vatican's exclusive archives.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The story of German architect Albert Speer, one of the only war criminals to accept his guilt during the Nuremberg trials, although there were doubts about the scale of his remorse.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team return to examine more items brought in by viewers, beginning with a visit to Plas Newydd Country House and Gardens on Anglesey. Collectibles assessed include a Victorian cane carved with an image of the Menai suspension bridge, an 18th century grandmother clock, and two giant toy giraffes.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: The drive to make trains faster, from supersonic rocket sleds to engines that seem to fly above their guideways.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A highway built in the Brazilian jungle as an escape route in the event of an emergency at a nuclear power station, a Soviet fortress and Ellis Island hospital.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: The Antiques Roadshow pays tribute to Her Majesty the Queen as she becomes Britain's longest-serving monarch.

programme.title: Mountain: Life at the Extreme
programme.desc: The final episode focuses on life on the longest mountain range in the world, the Andes, home to astonishing hidden worlds, and extraordinary animals and people. Cameras follow a female puma and her three cubs as they hunt in the mountains of the frozen south, and the descendants of the Inca gather in an ancient ceremony to build a bridge made from woven grass.

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough offers an insight into insect-eating animals, including shrews that dive under water, moles that can 'swim' in the Namib Desert, and New Zealand bats that hunt in packs on the ground, walking on their wrists and foraging. Plus, how hedgehogs and armadillos liven up their diet with fruit and birds' eggs, while pangolins and giant anteaters survive entirely on a diet of insects.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: Since their meteoric rise in the 19th Century, railways have been at the forefront of modern engineering. They've conquered dizzying altitudes, wilderness, seas and cities..

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The search for Josef Mengele, one of the most wanted Nazi war criminals, which was led by Holocaust survivor Simon Wiesenthal.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The story behind the Krupp company, who were responsible for the manufacture of two of Germany's most feared war products - the Panzer Tank and the U-boat.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A settlement in Argentina destroyed by floods, a town in the US that has been erased, and a Soviet dream-town that turned into a nuclear nightmare.

programme.title: The Architecture The Railways Built
programme.desc: Tim Dunn visits Ribblehead Viaduct in the Yorkshire Dales, talks to the man who saved it from closure and tours the breathtaking stations of the Hungerbergbahn in Innsbruck.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright tries to make Nurse Gladys Emmanuel jealous and decides to advertises for a live-in housekeeper, but is taken aback when Mrs Featherstone applies for the position.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville decides a fashion makeover is needed to impress Stephanie from the local boutique, but Arkwright's meddling soon puts paid to any romantic dalliance. Roy Clarke's classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Nurse Gladys decides Arkwright needs a lesson in politeness, and convinces him a writer for the Good Shop Guide is doing the rounds. She then poses as the critic to see for herself the unusual sight of the miserly shopkeeper being nice to his customers. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Lynda Baron.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Marlene allows Boycie to buy a maximum of six cows for the farm - and is less than impressed when Elgin, Jed and Bryan turn up with a herd of 300. The vet is called out when Rocky the bull fails to take any notice of the females, and Tyler prepares to sit a local private school's entrance exam. John Challis and Sue Holderness star.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Boycie struggles to come to terms with the news that his prize bull is gay, and Marlene finds she is missing the noise of the city after suffering sleepless nights. Tyler is delighted to learn he has failed all but two of his GCSEs, thinking he will no longer be accepted at a private school - but his parents have other ideas. John Challis and Sue Holderness star.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: The deaths of a local drug user and her infant child are disregarded by the police. When a small-time dealer dies after consuming what appears to be the same batch of the drug, Sam resolves to take matters into her own hands. Feature length episode of the forensic drama, starring Amanda Burton.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Jo Masters is assigned to look after a recently released child-killer who has jeopardised her new identity by disclosing it to a former acquaintance. Roger gallantly offers to let penniless Russian prostitute Anka Markova stay with him, while Sheelagh is disturbed to learn assault victim Zoe Dowman won't make a statement because she's afraid of ex-boyfriend Gabriel Kent. Pauline Quirke guest stars.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The new Sub Officer arrives for her first shift at Blackwall, and realises she faces an uphill struggle to win the respect of the team.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Pauline and Ian and everyone are reeling from the shocking news of the death of Pete. Gita is convinced Michelle had an affair with her husband.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Bernie Roberts looks to be the guilty party when she is involved in a road accident. Meanwhile, Kieron Voce faces criticism from senior officers.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Dave, Paddy, Tony and Luke plan a wild night out in Amsterdam, and Captain Keiron Voce and Kate Butler finally voice their feelings for each other.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Jo Masters is assigned to look after a recently released child-killer who has jeopardised her new identity by disclosing it to a former acquaintance. Roger gallantly offers to let penniless Russian prostitute Anka Markova stay with him, while Sheelagh is disturbed to learn assault victim Zoe Dowman won't make a statement because she's afraid of ex-boyfriend Gabriel Kent. Pauline Quirke guest stars.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Abra returns to the hospital, but Ric is not happy to be working with him - especially when he learns the surgeon has been making promises to patients that he will struggle to keep. Meanwhile, Mickie develops a crush on a patient, but is worried asking her out may harm her chances of getting into medical school.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Max tries to win the confidence of a newly arrived Czech refugee whose daughter has been hit by an airport baggage truck, while Charlie has trouble taking care of baby Louis, and a stand-up comic takes a nasty tumble during a performance. Medical drama, starring Derek Thompson and Robert Gwilym.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Sheelagh finally decides to accept Gabriel's marriage proposal, and Smithy patches up his friendship with Gina, who is feeling more amenable to his overtures now she's been given the cancer all-clear. Meanwhile, Roger agrees to investigate an assault on his estranged wife Sandra's new boyfriend Rick - whose reticence to discuss the incident is soon explained by the discovery that he's a crook.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Pauline is making Petes funeral arrangements which is stressing Arthur out! Richards gives Mandy and Adrian some bad news and Mark is not feeling well.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Aidan's troubles are getting to him, Nadia attempts to get Phil's attention, Frank doesn't appreciate Pat's attempts to solve their financial problems and Pete is laid to rest.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The strain of bringing up a child begins to show on Nick, Carole doubts her abilities and a garage blaze leads to danger.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Amy accidentally takes a photograph of what appears to be a monster emerging from the depths of Loch Bogle. A sceptical Paul has more pressing matters on his mind in the form of financial worries and the imminent departure of Iona. Ewan, however, is quick to cash in on the commercial possibilities as scientists arrive to investigate the creature. Susan Hampshire and Lloyd Owen star.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Unable to put the tragic loss of her baby behind her, a heartbroken Beth calls off the wedding, while the Scorpions decide to pose for a nude calendar to raise funds for the club's floodlights. Meanwhile, new parents Susan and Steve eagerly await Elaine's departure so they can be on their own with their baby _ little suspecting the houseguest has a surprise in store. Rural drama, starring Kerrie Taylor, Heather Peace, Daniel Ryan and Clare Holman.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Sharon is convinced her 30th birthday is just the start of another three decades of misery, prompting Tracey to question the wisdom of throwing a party. Pauline Quirke and Linda Robson star.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Boycie reluctantly signs up for Farm Idol, a new reality TV show aimed at finding Britain's sexiest rural workers, while Mrs Cakeworthy becomes suspicious of Marlene when a well-dressed man visits her while her husband is away. Comedy, starring John Challis and Sue Holderness.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo buys Sid's wetsuit and, under Foggy's supervision, tries scuba diving and waterskiing. Bill Owen and Brian Wilde star.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo manages to convince a barmaid that hapless Foggy is really an eccentric millionaire, having made his fortune in the frozen turkey business. Long-running comedy, starring Bill Owen and Brian Wilde.

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: The judge makes dangerous enemies by pressing the police for an inquiry into the death of Rufus Baron and also presides over the trial of the producers of a reality TV show, charged with manslaughter of a contestant. Starring Martin Shaw, with Jenny Seagrove and Ben Caplan.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team reopens the 16-year-old case of an infamous getaway driver convicted of murdering his wife when new evidence suggests it could have been a miscarriage of justice. But Gerry, who was on the original investigation, refuses to believe the prisoner is anything but guilty. Meanwhile, Brian is in a reflective mood, convinced his days at Ucos are numbered after his actions against former police commander Embleton. Alun Armstrong, Dennis Waterman and Denis Lawson star as the veteran coppers, with Amanda Redman as their boss.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature length episode. When a Cambridge farmer dies beneath the blades of a combine harvester, Sam believes the death to be a tragic accident until an anonymous tip-off indicates more sinister forces are at work. Investigating the motives of the victim's neighbour, a former soldier, Sam is able to produce few solid leads. However, when the informant is found dead, the intrepid pathologist uncovers an Army cover-up. Drama, starring Amanda Burton.

programme.title: ITV Football Classics
programme.desc: Cameroon v England. Gabriel Clarke introduces highlights of the thrilling 1990 World Cup quarter-final from Stadio San Paolo in Naples, Italy. With original coverage hosted by Nick Owen and Elton Welsby and pre-match analysis from Bobby Moore and Jimmy Greaves.

programme.title: Harry's Heroes: The Full English
programme.sub-title: Harry's Heroes: Euro Having a Laugh
programme.desc: Harry Redknapp takes his team of ex-England players on a European tour, as they prepare for a rematch against theGerman Legends on their own soil. They begin in France at a self-catering hotel in the quiet medieval town of Provins, where Harrywants them to be on a detox and cook their own healthy food, but they don't even get through the first night without hitting the beers and ending up at the curry house.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Culinary Genius
programme.desc: Rosemary Shrager is this week's guest judge on the cookery competition, with nine more contestants battle it out today for the 1,000 cash prize. The first challenge is designed to test the participants' knife skills, then six go on to prepare a guinea fowl before the final three concoct a sauce to go with the bird. Fern Britton hosts.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: The GMB team is joined by Lorraine Kelly for the final hour, with the latest on the coronavirus pandemic, as well as other stories.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: More celebrity interviews and topical debate from a female perspective.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis in which a family team from London competes to answer questions about top 10 lists, then tries to score a perfect 10 in the final round.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Parin, Sandy, John, and Sue pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Martin and Louisa have their first fertility consultation with Dr Emma Ryder. Meanwhile, a case of vandalism at a local surf school is reported and PC Joe Penhale investigates. Elsewhere, Dr Edward Mullen returns to the surgery, and Bert is feeling the pressure from Caitlin. Starring Martin Clunes, Lucy Russell and Conleth Hill.

programme.title: The Village
programme.desc: Art and music event Festival No 6 draws thousands of visitors to Portmeirion, as Meurig welcomes a few famous and familiar faces and gives one of his renowned tours. Meanwhile, Mark welcomes various Michelin-starred chefs and Delyth oversees a very special wedding.

programme.title: How to Keep Your Dog Happy at Home
programme.desc: Martin Clunes narrates more tips on how to keep dogs mentally stimulated during lockdown. Cameras follow Bodie, a Jack Russell that helps children with their reading, Summer, the golden retriever with maternal urges toward rescue kittens, and a dog that howls along to a 90s club hit.

programme.title: Harry's Heroes: The Full English
programme.sub-title: Harry's Heroes: Euro Having a Laugh
programme.desc: The second leg of the tour takes the boys to Italy, where they're holing up at a traditional Palazzo in Florence. Assistant Manager John Barnes thinks the lads need a bit of culture, so sends them off sightseeing to take in the Ponte Vecchio and Michelangelo's David. At training, fitness coach Luke Worthington puts the boys through their paces, but it's not looking good as the team is carrying so many injuries there are only three fit players. Plus, they've lost one of their biggest characters - Neil 'Razor' Ruddock - who had to leave the tour in Paris to return to London for tests on his heart.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Absolutely India: Mancs in Mumbai
programme.desc: Brothers Ryan, Adam and Scott Thomas embark on a journey to trace their family roots in India, joined by their dad Dougie, whose father was born in Mumbai. However, the trio have never visited the country they descended from. In the third episode, Ryan, Adam and Scott Thomas are on the trail of a very special cousin, before exploring one of Mumbai's most vibrant neighbourhoods.

programme.title: Secrets of the Driving Test
programme.desc: Seventeen-year-old Thea already has a car sitting at home and is desperate to pass - if she stops talking long enough to listen to her examiner. Also, Mollie and Cheryl are back, hoping to improve on their catastrophic last tests. For Mollie, it would be the end of 16 years of trying - and failing - to get on the road.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: Including the best way to stop a speeding car, and the secrets of a spectacular display that involves 75,000 litres of water being shot to an amazing height.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers: On the Road
programme.desc: After a nerve-racking test-drive, Mike Brewer buys a 1981 Series III Land Rover without an MOT for Edd China to restore.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Bruce purchases a Second World War army uniform for 40,000 when hunting for paratrooper gear, while Hus almost throws up when doing loops in a Mustang.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Paul Jr celebrates his win following the live show, while Paul Sr begins a big build and contemplates an opportunity to take part in Celebrity Apprentice.

programme.title: Alaska Mega Machines
programme.desc: An insight into how Alaska's airfields range from an airport made from nothing but water and ice, to a military instalment on stand-by to avert nuclear disaster.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe devises a plan to make homes energy efficient, and takes a job as an inseminator on a turkey farm.

programme.title: How It's Made: Dream Cars
programme.desc: The development of the manufacturing processes of a Maserati Quattroporte.

programme.title: How It's Made: Dream Cars
programme.desc: How a Weismann MF5 is made and how its manufacturing process has developed over the years.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How modern-day objects are created. This time, how islanders of the Outer Hebrides use pedal power to weave Harris tweed, and how fermented shark is prepared.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Sam Lovegrove continue their search through Britain's sheds in search of vintage treasure to restore and sell for a tidy profit. In Surrey, they find Pontiac ambulances, mysterious automotive sculptures and strangely well-preserved motorbikes.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Bike guru Henry Cole and ace mechanic Sam Lovegrove are off to Cornwall. They meet a collector whose cottage is like a transport museum, chock-full with memorabilia, penny farthings and lights of all description - watched over by Buster, the guard rabbit.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Opilio season draws to a close and two skippers suffer debilitating injuries, while the captain of the Wizard assaults an unlikely victim.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: With partner Dan stuck at home, Justin starts the new mining season alone. He is dealt a huge blow as he discovers their rich underground mine has been pegged by another miner.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: The work of demolition, salvage and waste management experts as they blast, crush and smash their way through a variety of structures which have had their day. In the world of destruction, they take huge risks, every time they blow up, demolish and dismantle. From tower blocks to ships and bridges to Victorian mansionsevery inch of material is removed as everything has value if you know where to take it and, more importantly, when to sell it.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer buys an XK8 Jaguar in poor condition, giving mechanic Edd China a tough challenge to fix it up within a tight budget.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini has 48 hours to make a deal on a 1972 Ferrari Daytona Spyder.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini takes a 1934 MG ND Magnette with a six cylinder engine to the Scottsdale Auction.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at how wood-burning stoves work, and how the development of the synthesiser helped change music for ever.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The construction process behind the creation of the reinvented Morgan three-wheeler. Plus, the making of flame-retardant materials that help protect firefighters from burns.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: With partner Dan stuck at home, Justin starts the new mining season alone. He is dealt a huge blow as he discovers their rich underground mine has been pegged by another miner.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The captain of the Seabrooke fights an agonising illness and the Northwestern takes revenge on the Time Bandit as the Bering Sea fleet finishes the season.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Bruce is doing up a wartime German tank engine so that he can pay for Glenn Miller's army uniform, a special Second World War relic.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard heads to a huge antiques wholesaler in Exeter, where he finds pile upon pile of affordable gems. Next, it's on to north London, to visit an emporium of curiosities.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: In Surrey, the team demolishes a 1930s housing estate. Meanwhile, some cars are crushed by monster trucks and old motorcycle parts are turned into a metallic art piece.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers: On the Road
programme.desc: After a nerve-racking test-drive, Mike Brewer buys a 1981 Series III Land Rover without an MOT for Edd China to restore.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Rookie Justin's second-hand excavator develops an expensive oil leak. Col's crew are a man down and the Fire Crew are on a wild goose-chase hunting a bounty of fabled fire opal.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Salvager Drew Pritchard explores a Napoleonic fort in Essex, and tours the medieval Lichfield Cathedral, where he checks out some unwanted objects.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: In Oldham, a magistrates' court is torn down. Plus, in Halifax car brake discs are given new life and in Wokingham an old horse transporter reaches the end of the road.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Steven Fletcher tackles an intricate Boulle-work clock that has not ticked for more than 15 years, and soft toy restorers Julie Tatchell and Amanda Middleditch take on a threadbare wheeled elephant. Woodwork specialist William Kirk gets to grips with one of the show's oldest assignments in the form of a 300-year-old Georgian desk that is showing its age.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The production of steel cables capable of supporting a 50,000-ton bridge, why modern hunters still use medieval weaponry and the systems involved in determining the correct quantities of clothing sizes to stock.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The distillation of traditional Tennessee whiskey, the inner workings of night-vision goggles and the relaxing properties of Finnish saunas.

programme.title: Dead of Winter
programme.desc: A mother and her two young children mysteriously go missing. Then, two local boys nearby also disappear. Is there a serial predator on the loose in rural Missouri?.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Investigators who use minute scraps of evidence to discover the full story behind a murder and solve serious crimes.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of Maurice Byrd, who was shot dead in his home. Security footage revealed he had many visitors before his body was discovered.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: A case in which two college students were gunned down while parked in a quiet lovers' lane. Residents of the tiny community of Juliette, Georgia, were beside themselves with panic.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: How offshore bank accounts and almost $2million in insurance money led police to suspect a man of killing his wife.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Police raid a cockfight, and a couple who foster unwanted animals find they have too many to cope with.

programme.title: Bondi Vet: Coast to Coast
programme.desc: Dr Kate anxiously awaits her dog's test results. Dr Danni volunteers at a pop-up clinic, while Dr Alex has a house call check-up with a pig and her piglets.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Stella brings along an entourage ahead of her Greek wedding, while Carli arrives for her final fitting.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: The Big Day
programme.desc: A former professional cheerleader has a clear vision of how she wants her wedding day to look.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown looks after Lulu, a sneezing Labradoodle, while Dr Lisa Chimes strives to a save a dog that has been bitten by an infected tick.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Lisa Chimes is under pressure to help a puppy that has been trampled on by its owner, while Dr Chris Brown travels to Adelaide to check on an extremely aggressive Peccary.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: A team of investigators responds to reports that a group of cats is being mistreated.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: A team of investigators responds to reports of animal cruelty, rescuing pets and dealing with abusive owners.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: A team of experts analyses the remains of a woman found in woods two years after she was reported missing. Plus, police uncover clues to the murder of a night porter.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: A case in which a mother and Bible teacher went missing from her family's farm. Investigators in Missouri had to decipher a cryptic handwritten note, while a walk in nearby woods uncovered a mysterious skull.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 38-year-old Eric Franks, who vanished while preparing to move house with his long-lost high school girlfriend and the daughter they had together. However, he failed to called his mother after March 2011, leaving police struggling for answers as to his whereabouts.

programme.title: Reasonable Doubt
programme.desc: The case of rapper Mac Phipps. After a young fan was shot and killed at one of his concerts in a Louisiana club, Mac was arrested and convicted for the crime.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Kate heads to the salon with an entourage that includes her father, and Nancy takes advice from her fashionista dad, as both brides try to find the perfect dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Liza returns to the salon to top her dress with two skirts she has designed. Leanne purchases a cheap gown without conviction, and Ivania arrives with her opinionated fiance.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Former waitress Janine, who is used to striking clothes, has a princess gown in mind. Meanwhile, pregnant bride Christina is worried about her growing body.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Michelle expresses her interest in dresses by the salon's exclusive designer, Pnina Tornai. Meanwhile, a Greek woman looks for a bargain, and Audrey and Randy try to please Lillian.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Niki Ann arrives at the shop with a $5,000 budget, Dawn's mother turns up with something to help make shopping easier and Kristyn plans to wow her guests with her dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Jesyca wants a flattering dress, Duvae is looking for something sophisticated and Sara returns for her fitting, following her surprise proposal at Kleinfeld's.

programme.title: French Collection
programme.desc: Three Brits with a passion for vintage homewares head to a market in Toulouse market in the south of France and buy things they can upcycle before selling for profit in St Albans.

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: The staff at Prestige Pawnbrokers are blown away by two jaw-dropping diamond necklaces, owned by two very different clients. Single mum Marcella is looking for a better future for herself and her son and needs 20,000 to kick-start her music career, while wealthy mother-of-four Ingrid wants to raise capital for her new horse importation and training business. However, staff member Patrick thinks that one of the necklaces could be fake.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part two of two. Devoted girlfriend and loving aunt Alicia is all smiles on the outside, though inside is terrified her addiction to food will kill her before she can marry.

programme.title: My 3000lb Family
programme.sub-title: The Kings: A New Journey Begins
programme.desc: Three cousins - Casey, Amy and Ed - try to lose weight as they follow in their other cousin Amanda's footsteps after she decides to have bariatric surgery.

programme.title: My Naked Secret
programme.desc: A man who suffers from psoriasis on almost all of his body seeks help to reconnect with the world after years of trying to deal with his condition alone.

programme.title: My Naked Secret
programme.desc: Documentary exploring people's physical concerns, beginning with a woman suffering from post-pregnancy split stomach muscles. She undergoes a radical new treatment.

programme.title: Dead of Winter
programme.desc: The disappearance of 21-year-old Noel Alkaramla, who vanished just before Thanksgiving 2015. In November 2017, her stepfather Johnny Oquendo was put on trial for her murder.
